title: Kobold brigand
data:

|   | A kobold that is bigger and tougher than the ordinary kobold, with a penchant for underhanded tactics.***“The Parts Septentrionall are with these Sp’ryts Much haunted.. About the places where they dig for Oare. The Greekes and Germans call them Cobali.” -Thomas Heywood, \_The Hierarchy of the Blessed Angels\_, Book IX, l. 568. 1635. |

## Useful Info

**Kobold brigands** are much like their [smaller cousins](/Kobold_\(monster\) "Kobold (monster)"), only tougher, stronger, and more likely to be found in packs. They may spawn with [curare](/Curare "Curare") darts. They can be found in the middle [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon") and [the Sewers](/The_Sewers "The Sewers").

## Tips & Tricks

- Low level characters should definitely try to force kobold packs into corridors to keep them from using their [darts](/Dart "Dart") or surrounding you. If you can lure them into melee (and are strong enough in melee to deal with them), this may help you avoid death by [curare](/Curare "Curare").
- Should you encounter one of the kobold vaults in the Dungeon, expect to have to fight through about five or six brigands in addition to a dozen or so of their lesser brethren. Buffing yourself with [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations") and/or a [potion](/Potion "Potion") or two may be a good idea, especially if you're not built for pure melee combat. Fortunately, most such vaults open into a corridor that you can lure them into and thus fight them one at a time.
  - Fragile spellcasters should use any crowd-control spells they have ([Mephitic Cloud](/Mephitic_Cloud "Mephitic Cloud") or [Olgreb's Toxic Radiance](/Olgreb%27s_Toxic_Radiance "Olgreb's Toxic Radiance") work well). If you need to flee, teleporting away helps avoid the barrage of darts you'll incur by just legging it.
- You can often trick kobold brigands found in the Sewers into fighting from [shallow water](/Shallow_water "Shallow water"). This greatly reduces their melee combat skills if you're fighting from dry land (or if you're not penalized by fighting in shallow water yourself).

## History

- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), kobold brigands were known as **big kobolds**.

Kobold brigand

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of all kobolds, see list of kobolds.

kobold brigand K 
HP 18-37
HD 5
XP 97
Speed 10
AC 3
EV 12
Will 20
Attack1 7 (hit: plain)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type kobold, kobold
Flags Speaks
Warm-blooded
A kobold that is bigger and tougher than the ordinary kobold, with a penchant for underhanded tactics.

“The Parts Septentrionall are with these Sp’ryts Much haunted.. About the places where they dig for Oare. The Greekes and Germans call them Cobali.”
-Thomas Heywood, _The Hierarchy of the Blessed Angels_, Book IX, l. 568. 1635.

Useful Info

Kobold brigands are much like their smaller cousins, only tougher, stronger, and more likely to be found in packs. They may spawn with curare darts. They can be found in the middle Dungeon and the Sewers.

Tips & Tricks

  • Low level characters should definitely try to force kobold packs into corridors to keep them from using their darts or surrounding you. If you can lure them into melee (and are strong enough in melee to deal with them), this may help you avoid death by curare.
  • Should you encounter one of the kobold vaults in the Dungeon, expect to have to fight through about five or six brigands in addition to a dozen or so of their lesser brethren. Buffing yourself with Invocations and/or a potion or two may be a good idea, especially if you're not built for pure melee combat. Fortunately, most such vaults open into a corridor that you can lure them into and thus fight them one at a time.
    • Fragile spellcasters should use any crowd-control spells they have (Mephitic Cloud or Olgreb's Toxic Radiance work well). If you need to flee, teleporting away helps avoid the barrage of darts you'll incur by just legging it.
  • You can often trick kobold brigands found in the Sewers into fighting from shallow water. This greatly reduces their melee combat skills if you're fighting from dry land (or if you're not penalized by fighting in shallow water yourself).

History

  • Prior to 0.27, kobold brigands were known as big kobolds.

{{list of|kobolds}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Kobold brigands''' are much like their [[kobold_(monster)|smaller cousins]], only tougher, stronger, and more likely to be found in packs. They may spawn with [[curare]] darts. They can be found in the middle [[Dungeon]] and [[the Sewers]].

==Tips & Tricks==
*Low level characters should definitely try to force kobold packs into corridors to keep them from using their [[dart]]s or surrounding you. If you can lure them into melee (and are strong enough in melee to deal with them), this may help you avoid death by [[curare]].
*Should you encounter one of the kobold vaults in the Dungeon, expect to have to fight through about five or six brigands in addition to a dozen or so of their lesser brethren. Buffing yourself with [[Invocations]] and/or a [[potion]] or two may be a good idea, especially if you're not built for pure melee combat. Fortunately, most such vaults open into a corridor that you can lure them into and thus fight them one at a time.
**Fragile spellcasters should use any crowd-control spells they have ([[Mephitic Cloud]] or [[Olgreb's Toxic Radiance]] work well). If you need to flee, teleporting away helps avoid the barrage of darts you'll incur by just legging it.
*You can often trick kobold brigands found in the Sewers into fighting from [[shallow water]]. This greatly reduces their melee combat skills if you're fighting from dry land (or if you're not penalized by fighting in shallow water yourself).

==History==
*Prior to [[0.27]], kobold brigands were known as '''big kobolds'''.
